item.title: Transform your business reporting with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
item.description:
Data reigns supreme in today’s business world. The wide range of data tools available to companies means that real-time reporting has become key in shaping strategic direction. Businesses need fast access to data to make informed decisions quickly and adapt to changing market conditions.

This approach increases the pressure on teams to deliver accurate reports with short turnaround times. But producing these reports is a much bigger challenge than it seems. Many organisations still struggle with scattered data, limited analytical capabilities, and slow reporting processes that leave them trailing behind competitors. The solution? A unified reporting system that brings all business data together.

item.title: Protect your business from data loss with Microsoft Purview
item.description:
Did you know that by 2025, global data creation is expected to reach 175 zettabytes? That is the equivalent of 35 trillion HD movies. With this explosion of data growth, safeguarding sensitive information has never been more critical. Businesses operate in an environment where sensitive data is shared every day, sometimes unknowingly, which poses a heightened security threat to them.

With the constant evolution of AI technology, traditional security boundaries quickly become obsolete and cyber threats adjust to new circumstances. This means that companies need to have a strong data-protection strategy in place. In this blog, we explore how Microsoft Purview can help prevent data loss, ensure compliance, and manage the challenges of AI-driven data security.

item.title: Discovering Microsoft Entra: A guide to Microsoft's identity and security suite
item.description: Stolen credentials drive one in five security breaches. According to Forrester, the average organisation experienced a yearly average of 3.1 material security breaches at an average cost per breach of $750,000. Going on this statistic, breaches will cost the average organisation over $2 million per year – a number that is hard to ignore for something that can be prevented at the root. Adding security layers to your workflows is an obvious solution, but these often come at the expense of efficiency. The question then becomes: how do you fortify security without hindering productivity?

item.title: Codec Portal Accelerator: Fast-tracking the creation & implementation of online citizen portals.
item.description:
Meeting the requirements caused by outdated legacy processes is a common occurrence during digital transformation. With an increasing number of public organisations transitioning from paper to pixels, they often find that creating their online citizen portal brings with it many specific requirements.  

Most of the time, off-the-shelf solutions cannot fully meet these requirements, resulting in an extensive and slow customisation and integration process that causes service delays and budget overruns. This scenario leaves these organisations caught between the desire for swift implementation and the need for a bespoke functionality.  

Enter the Codec Portal Accelerator, a groundbreaking solution that bridges this gap, offering the speed of pre-built components with the flexibility of custom development. By providing a more flexible, modular, and scalable solution that adheres to accessibility standards, such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), while also complying with critical data privacy regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Codec’s Portal Accelerator is a tool that provides a fully customised portal in a shortened timescale.

item.description: Businesses are facing mounting pressure as the pace of competition continues to accelerate. With growing complexity and less time to deliver results, the need to become more efficient has become a priority – but how long can businesses rely on outdated tools before they fall behind?

item.title: Webinar: Zero Trust rapid adoption - A customer perspective
item.description:
This insightful webinar  "Zero Trust Rapid Adoption with Microsoft Technology" explores how organisations are successfully leveraging Microsoft tools to implement robust Zero Trust strategies. Tushar Kumar, Azure MVP and Security practice lead discusses practical insights, real-world success stories, and actionable guidance to help you accelerate your Zero Trust journey while enhancing security and reducing risks. 

Additionally, this webinar addressed the recent announcements by Microsoft around guidance for CISA Zero Trust Maturity model designed to help organisations configure Microsoft cloud services as they transition to Zero Trust on their journey to achieve optimal security.
